hanzi-su-wiki:
射

Значения

Стрелять, излучать, светить; светить, падать (о свете)

Мнемоника

Выпускать из себя. Чтобы родить, беременной женщине 身 нужно тужиться. Один из шести приемов стрельбы — умение напрягаться. Поэтому раньше вместо руки 寸 писали стрелу.

выстрелить; запускать; ссылаться на; радио- (химия)

purpleculture_examples:
发射 [ fā shè ]: to shoot (a projectile); to fire (a rocket); to launch; to emit (a particle); to discharge; emanation; emission
辐射 [ fú shè ]: radiation
射击 [ shè jī ]: to shoot; to fire (a gun)
反射 [ fǎn shè ]: to reflect; reflection (from a mirror etc); reflex (i.e. automatic reaction of organism)
射线 [ shè xiàn ]: ray

• ⿰ Left to right
    • 身 [ shēn ] body, torso; person; pregnancy
    • 寸 [ cùn ] inch; small, tiny
heisig_chinese_memo: You SHOOT SOMEBODY with a GLUE-gun.
heisig_story: "I shot an arrow into the air, And it landed I know not where" goes the poem. (The poor poet obviously loses a lot of arrows.) This kanji, however, tells us where it did land. Its elements: somebody . . . glued to.
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: стрелять, блеск в, на, стрельба из лука
koohiiStory1: You SHOOT SOMEBODY with a GLUE-gun.
koohiiStory2: The aim of shooting is to end up with a bullet stuck in someone´s body.
jp_example_words:
反射(はんしゃ): reflection, reverberation
放射(ほうしゃ): radiation, emission
放射能(ほうしゃのう): radioactivity
射す(さす): to shine, to strike
発射(はっしゃ): firing, shooting, discharge, catapult
陽射(ひざし): sunlight
注射(ちゅうしゃ): inject
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You need to take a body measurement before you can shoot. Whether it's for a photo shoot, you're gonna shoot them with a gun, or if you're about to shoot them full of radiation for X-rays, you need the right measurements of that body first.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine someone measuring your body before they shoot you. You hope it's the good kind of shoot and that you're not going to die.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This shoot is being done by a shaman (しゃ). Not only is he doing the body measurements for the shoot, but he's also going to be shooting you with a shot so you don't get the flu.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Shamans are just a different kind of doctor. And this shot is going to save you from getting the flu, which could kill you. Make sure you always go to the local shaman and schedule a shooting.
Ru_trainchinese: shè: (глаг) стрелять, вести огонь; впрыскивать; намекать на; выпускать, излучать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: what goes an inch (寸) into the body (身) is a shot
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You SHOOT SOMEBODY with a GLUE-gun.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from " bow " to " arrow " means to shoot arrows. Bronze inscriptions may add " again " to resemble a hand pulling a bowstring. The Chu characters have changed from the " bow " to the inverted " vector " shape (Zhu Dexi, Qiu Xigui), and the Qin characters mistaken the "bow and arrow" as " body ", and the " again " shape is added to " inch ". From Xiaozhuan to regular script, the word " shoot " is derived from " body " and " inch ", which inherits the writing of Qin characters.

"Shuowen": "The bow and crossbow are sent from the body and the center is far away. From the arrow from the body. Shoot, and the seal script is from the inch. Cun, the law is also the hand." It can be seen that Xu Shen still knows that " cun " is like archery. However, based on the small seal character, he mistakenly believed that " inch " meant a mana, and believed that " shooting " from " body " was because the bow and arrow were sent from the archer. As for Wang Anshi's misunderstanding that "inch body" is regarded as " short " and "weiya" is regarded as " shooting ", it is also a misunderstanding based on the corrupted character form.

The word " shoot " oracle bone inscriptions is used as the original meaning of archery. For example, "Collection" 10276: "Shooting a deer, only (get)." It can also be used as an official name, such as "Collection" 5733: "Don't make more shooting." Handed down documents such as "Zhou Li" have "shooting people" A post. " Shoot " can also be used as a place name.

" Shooting " is one of the "six arts" in ancient education. It refers to archery, but the " shooting " seen in the inscriptions is not used in military or field hunting. Instead, it is mostly the shooting ceremony of princes (Liu Yu). Such as Yizhengai: "The king is only (in) Lu, and the union is the prince, the prince, the righteous, and you have a big shot." It means that the king is in Lu and he shoots together with the princes, righteous and yousi, and holds a big shot. ceremony. For the record of "Big Shooting Ceremony" in handed down documents, please refer to "Yi Li. Big Shot Seventh. Another example is Jing: "Wang Lingjing shoots the palace." It means that the king ordered Jing to preside over archery in the palace.

See " Hou ".
humanum_short_description_en: " shoot " from Oracle word " bow " from " vector ", as imminent, inscriptions or add " yet " (like a hand) to highlight the original meaning of archery.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文从「弓」从「矢」，會射箭之意。金文或加「又」以象拉動弓弦的手。楚文字從「弓」從倒「矢」形(朱德熙、裘錫圭)，秦文字則把「弓矢」訛為「身」，「又」形加繁為「寸」。小篆到楷書「射」字從「身」從「寸」，即繼承秦文字的寫法而來。

　　《說文》：「䠶，弓弩發於身而中於遠也。從矢從身。射，篆文䠶從寸。寸，法度也，亦手也。」可見許慎仍然知道「寸」象射箭的手，但他根據小篆字形，誤以為「寸」為有法度的意思，又認為「射」從「身」是因為弓箭從射手身上發出。至於王安石以為「寸身」當作「矮」，「委矢」當作「射」，也是依據訛變字形而產生的誤解。

　　「射」字甲骨文用作本義，表示射箭。如《合集》10276：「射鹿，隻(獲)。」又可用作職官名，如《合集》5733：「勿令多射。」傳世文獻如《周禮》即有「射人」一職。「射」又可用作地名。

　　「射」乃古代教育中的「六藝」之一，指的固是射箭，但金文所見「射」皆非用於軍事或田獵上，反而多為王侯的射禮(劉雨)。如義盉蓋：「王才(在)魯，合即邦君、者(諸)侯、正、有𤔲大射。」指王在魯地，與諸侯、正、有司合射，舉行大射禮。傳世文獻對「大射禮」之記載可參《儀禮．大射第七》。另又如靜𣪕：「王令靜𤔲射學宮。」指王命令靜於學宮中主持射箭。

　　參見「侯」。
humanum_short_description: 「射」字甲骨文从「弓」从「矢」，象箭在弦上，金文或加「又」(象手形)以突顯射箭的本義。

甲骨文从「 弓 」从「 矢 」，會射箭之意。金文或加「 又 」以象拉動弓弦的手。楚文字從「 弓 」從倒「 矢 」形(朱德熙、裘錫圭)，秦文字則把「弓矢」訛為「 身 」，「 又 」形加繁為「 寸 」。小篆到楷書「 射 」字從「 身 」從「 寸 」，即繼承秦文字的寫法而來。 《說文》：「䠶，弓弩發於身而中於遠也。從矢從身。射，篆文䠶從寸。寸，法度也，亦手也。」可見許慎仍然知道「 寸 」象射箭的手，但他根據小篆字形，誤以為「 寸 」為有法度的意思，又認為「 射 」從「 身 」是因為弓箭從射手身上發出。至於王安石以為「寸身」當作「 矮 」，「委矢」當作「 射 」，也是依據訛變字形而產生的誤解。 「 射 」字甲骨文用作本義，表示射箭。如《合集》10276：「射鹿，隻(獲)。」又可用作職官名，如《合集》5733：「勿令多射。」傳世文獻如《周禮》即有「射人」一職。「 射 」又可用作地名。 「 射 」乃古代教育中的「六藝」之一，指的固是射箭，但金文所見「 射 」皆非用於軍事或田獵上，反而多為王侯的射禮(劉雨)。如義盉蓋：「王才(在)魯，合即邦君、者(諸)侯、正、有𤔲大射。」指王在魯地，與諸侯、正、有司合射，舉行大射禮。傳世文獻對「大射禮」之記載可參《儀禮．大射第七》。另又如靜𣪕：「王令靜𤔲射學宮。」指王命令靜於學宮中主持射箭。 參見「 侯 」。
Oracle from " bow" to " arrow" means to shoot arrows. Bronze inscriptions may add " again" to resemble a hand pulling a bowstring. The Chu characters have changed from the " bow" to the inverted " vector" shape (Zhu Dexi, Qiu Xigui), and the Qin characters mistaken the "bow and arrow" as " body", and the " again" shape is added to " inch". From Xiaozhuan to regular script, the word " shoot" is derived from " body" and " inch", which inherits the writing of Qin characters. "Shuowen": "The bow and crossbow are sent from the body and the center is far away. From the arrow from the body. Shoot, and the seal script is from the inch. Cun, the law is also the hand." It can be seen that Xu Shen still knows that " cun" is like archery. However, based on the small seal character, he mistakenly believed that " inch" meant a mana, and believed that " shooting" from " body" was because the bow and arrow were sent from the archer. As for Wang Anshi's misunderstanding that "inch body" is regarded as " short" and "weiya" is regarded as " shooting", it is also a misunderstanding based on the corrupted character form. The word " shoot" oracle bone inscriptions is used as the original meaning of archery. For example, "Collection" 10276: "Shooting a deer, only (get)." It can also be used as an official name, such as "Collection" 5733: "Don't make more shooting." Handed down documents such as "Zhou Li" have "shooting people" A post. " Shoot" can also be used as a place name. " Shooting" is one of the "six arts" in ancient education. It refers to archery, but the " shooting" seen in the inscriptions is not used in military or field hunting. Instead, it is mostly the shooting ceremony of princes (Liu Yu). Such as Yizhengai: "The king is only (in) Lu, and the union is the prince, the prince, the righteous, and you have a big shot." It means that the king is in Lu and he shoots together with the princes, righteous and yousi, and holds a big shot. ceremony. For the record of "Big Shooting Ceremony" in handed down documents, please refer to "Yi Li. Big Shot Seventh. Another example is Jing: "Wang Lingjing shoots the palace." It means that the king ordered Jing to preside over archery in the palace. See " Hou".

射字的基本解释

射
shè
放箭：射箭。后羿射日。
用推力或弹力送出子弹等：射击。扫射。发射。射程。射手。
气体或液体等受到压力迅速流出：喷射。注射。
放出光、热、电波等：射电。辐射。射线。照射。反射。
有所指：暗射。影射。

射
yè
〔射干〕古书上的一种草，根可入药。
〔仆射〕中国秦至宋代的官名，宋代以后废。

射
yì
〔无射〕a.中国古代音乐十二律之一；b.中国春秋时景王所铸钟名。

射字的起名意思

用弓发箭使中远处目标。

Shoot
Basic explanation of words
Shoot
shè
Arrows: Archery. Hou Yi shot the sun.
Use thrust or elastic force to send out bullets, etc.: shooting. Strafing. emission. Range. Shooter.
Gas or liquid flows out quickly under pressure: jetting. injection.
Emit light, heat, electric waves, etc.: radio. radiation. Rays. Irradiate. reflection.
Referred: Dark shot. Insinuation.
Shoot
yè
[Shegan] A kind of grass in ancient books whose roots can be used as medicine.
[Pu She] The official name of China from Qin to Song Dynasty, abolished after Song Dynasty.
Shoot
yì
[No Shot] a. One of the twelve rhythms of ancient Chinese music; b. The name of the bell cast by the King of the Spring and Autumn Period in China.
Shoot
Chinese dictionary definition of words
Shoot
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
Shoot
Source glyph
Shoot
Name meaning
Use a bow to shoot arrows to make the target in the middle and far away.
shè
1) стрелять из лука, пускать стрелу; вести стрельбу, вести огонь, стрельба, огонь (пушечный, ружейный)
一射枪中 (zhòng) одним выстрелом попасть в цель
扫射 вести шквальный огонь
疾风射 ураганный огонь
2) лететь стрелой, нестись пулей
小分队像一支暗箭, 向威虎山射去 отделение, подобно тайно пущенной стреле, летело (неслось) на Вэйхушань
3) проецироваться; выступать; ложиться, падать
月光射到地上 лунный свет льётся на землю
射四寸 выступать (выдаваться) на четыре цуня
4) стрелять (напр. дичь) ; убивать стрелами (выстрелами)
射天上之飞鸟 стрелять в птиц на небе
5) выпускать, метать; выбрасывать; разбрызгивать; излучать
射出三颗炮弹 выпускать три снаряда
射了他一身水 забрызгать его с ног до головы водой
箭射得挺准 стрела была пущена совершенно точно
6) охотиться за; выуживать, добывать спекулятивным путём
射大利 охотиться за большими доходами; разживаться
7) угадывать, догадываться; разгадывать
射中了灯谜儿 разгадать загадку
8) вульг. кончать, эякулировать
快要射啦！сейчас кончу!
9) стрельба из лука (предмет обучения в старом Китае до XIX в.)
射御 стрельба из лука и управление колесницей
五射 пять видов стрельбы из лука
-----
1) yì утомляться (чем-л.), испытывать утомление (скуку); чувствовать пресыщение
无射于人斯! пусть не наскучит ему (предку) поклонение людское!
2) yì кит. муз. вм. 无射 (yu, 6-я мужская ступень кит. хроматического звукоряда)
3) yì вм. 亦 (тоже, также)
4) shè * явление; форма, образ
百射重戒 во всяком явлении быть сугубо осмотрительным
5) shè вм. 射宫 (рабочая комната императора)
Radicals: 身, 寸  (body, measurement)
Meaning Mnemonic
You need to take a body measurement before you can shoot. Whether it's for a photo shoot, you're gonna shoot them with a gun, or if you're about to shoot them full of radiation for X-rays, you need the right measurements of that body first.
Imagine someone measuring your body before they shoot you. You hope it's the good kind of shoot and that you're not going to die.
Reading Mnemonic
This shoot is being done by a shaman (しゃ). Not only is he doing the body measurements for the shoot, but he's also going to be shooting you with a shot so you don't get the flu.
Shamans are just a different kind of doctor. And this shot is going to save you from getting the flu, which could kill you. Make sure you always go to the local shaman and schedule a shooting.
